section.title: Install the DNS Service with InfoBlox
section.para: &kw-hos; DNS Service can be installed with the InfoBlox backend instead of the default PowerDNS backend. In order to use InfoBlox as the backend, all prerequisites must be satisfied and the configuration of InfoBlox complete.

note.para: No DNS server will be deployed onto the &kw-hos; nodes. Instead, zones will be hosted on the InfoBlox servers.

important.para: The InfoBlox integration was enabled and validated in &kw-hos; 3.x. To use InfoBlox with version [4.x / 5.x] we recommend that you review the InfoBlox Deployment guide which can be found here: https://www.infoblox.com/wp-content/uploads/infoblox-deployment-guide-infoblox-openstack-driver.pdf and address any questions with your InfoBlox support contact.

listitem.para: An existing InfoBlox system deployed within your organization.
IPs and other credentials required to access the InfoBlox WS API.
Network connectivity to and from the cluster containing designate and the InfoBlox WS API.

section.para: This information is available from your InfoBlox system administrator.

If not already present, DNS Service components must be placed on a cluster. Additionally, ensure the default powerdns component has been removed, and bind has not been added. Replace the designate-mdns component with the designate-mdns-external component.

section.para: You will need to provide DNS Service information details on your InfoBlox deployment. Open the designate pool-manager configuration template:
In the config/designate/pool-manager.conf.j2, find the following code block:
section.screen: nameservers: - host: <infoblox-server-ip> port: <infoblox-port-number> ... also_notifies: - host: <infoblox-server-ip> port: <infoblox-port-number>

listitem.para: Uncomment the block for infoblox and also_notifies. In Jinja2, this means replacing the {# and #} markers with {{ and }}.
Fill in the API URL, username, password, and all remaining fields.
